div.p:
Speaking of the increase of herceivy
(Wh some ascribe to Harrison) Neither do I speak this reproach of any man as every man God is my judge, but rather I do rejoice to see how God & be has blest us with his good gifts and enabled to behold how that in a time Where all things are grown to such ex cessive prices we do yet find the mean to obtain & admire such furniture as heretofore has been found impossible: There are old men? women? yet dwelling in the village where I remain which have noted 3 things to be marvellously altered in England within their sound remembrance - One is the multitude of chimnies lately created whereas in their young days there were but two or three of so small in most uplandish towns of the realm - the religious house, and manor houses of their Lords always excepted & peradven ture some great personage ) But each made his fireby means of a rere dosse in the hall, Where he dined and dressed his meat The 2nd is the great amendment in lodging for said your father and ourselves have lain full of it on straw pallets covered only with a sheet under coverlets of dogs or hop harlots I use their own terms & a good round log under their head as a bolster) If it were so that the father or goodman of the house had a mattress or feather bed & thereon a sack of chaff to rest his head upon he thought himself as well looked as the lord of the town - Pillows said they are thought fit only for sick woman as for servants if they had any sheet above them
well for seldom had they any under theirbodies to keep them from the pricking straws that raise oft through the canvas & rare other hardened the 3d thing they tell of is the exchange of platters (so called from tree wood) into pewter & wooden spoons into silver or tin - for so common were all sorts of vessels in those times that a man could hardly find 4 pieces of pewter of which one was peradventure was a Salt- ) in a good farm house Hollingshead prefixed to his history - wh some suppose ascribed to Harrison Autograph of Maria Edgeworth obtained from CaptnBeaufort Dear Lovell Now that we hope you are recovering from yr
